Description: Vintage Ray Ban B&L Arnold Palmer St. Andrews sunglasses with tortoise frame and grey glass lenses. Securely dispatched in padded card box postal packaging. No case.Condition: Good vintage condition with no significant marks on lenses. There is a repair to the right arm (see close up photos). Size: At widest point 140mm, lens width 56mm.PayPal only please, items dispatched within 24 hours of payment Shipping to UK 2 days, EU 6 days, US and rest of the world 7 to 10 days with tracking code. No extra shipping charge for extra items (2 items for 1 charge, 3 items 1 charge, etc). Items will be sent to your PayPal delivery address unless I am notified otherwise. Regarding Vintage Ray Bans: - From 1937 to 1998 Ray Bans were made by an optics company called Bausch and Lomb in USA and France, hence the 'BL' engraving on vintage lenses. The 'Ray Ban' logo printed on the lens only appeared on later models from the 80's onwards, earlier examples with no lens logo printed are still genuine - From 1998 to present day Ray Bans have been made by a company called Luxottica in Italy, lenses inscribed with 'RB'
